name: Academic Writing
description: Grammar, sentence structure, paragraph and essay organization of formal written English.

name: Academic Writing
description: Grammar, sentence structure, paragraph and essay organization of formal written English.
prereqString: Prerequisite: AC ENG 20A. Placement into AC ENG 20B is also accepted.

name: Essentials of Academic Writing
description: Grammar, sentence structure, paragraph and essay organization of formal written English.
prereqString: Prerequisite: AC ENG 20B. Placement into AC ENG 20C is also accepted.

name: Academic Writing
description: Grammar, sentence structure, paragraph and essay organization of formal written English.

name: Academic English Reading and Vocabulary
description: Intensive reading exercises with occasional practice in extensive reading, focusing on comprehension, development of vocabulary, syntax, rhetorical features, reading strategies, and study skills.
prereqString: Prerequisite: Placement into AC ENG 22A is required.

name: ESL Reading and Vocabulary
description: Extensive reading and discussion with emphasis on journal articles, textbook chapters, notetaking, and the interpretation of charts, diagrams, tables, and figures.

name: Oral English Communication I
description: Designed to help students hear and produce the sounds of English as an International Language with greater accuracy and confidence. Focuses on pronunciation features (e.g., consonant sounds, consonant clusters, vowels, thought groups, and nuclear stress).

name: Oral English Communication II
description: Designed to help students develop conversational fluency in English as an International Language. Focuses on applying knowledge of linguistic features and communicative skills during conversational exchange in a variety of social, academic, and professional contexts.

name: Oral English Communication III
description: Designed to help students hone their public speaking skills in English as an International Language. Focuses on preparing, organizing, and delivering speeches and presentations and interacting with the audience, emphasizing skills needed in academic settings.
prereqString: Prerequisite: AC ENG 23A or AC ENG 23B

name: ESL International TA Workshop
description: Designed for advanced-level international students preparing to be teaching assistants. Provides extensive practice in oral and written communication skills associated with teaching introductory-level college courses and participating in academic presentations and discussions. Review and analysis of language problems.
prereqString: Prerequisite: AC ENG 23A or AC ENG 23B or AC ENG 23C

name: Grammar
description: A full review of English grammar covering the following areas: grammar terms, verb tenses, verb forms, conditionals, passive and word forms, punctuation, sentence structure. The concepts are applied in targeted sentence and paragraph writing practice.

name: Special Topics in ESL
description: Directed and individualized work in English as a second language not covered in the AC ENG 20, 21, 22 sequence.

name: Advanced Academic Writing Across the Curriculum
description: Designed for transfer students who speak English as a second language. Focuses on developing academic reading and writing skills including essay content, organization, vocabulary, and grammar. Academic content also covered.
prereqString: Prerequisite: Satisfactory completion of the Lower-Division Writing requirement.
restriction: Restriction: Restricted to students whose first language is not English.
